item.title: Connecting Zotero to AI Assistants via MCP
item.description:
If you use Zotero for managing your research library, you might want to talk to your papers using an AI assistant. The Model Context Protocol (MCP) makes this possible — your AI can search, summarize, and analyze your local Zotero library without uploading anything to third-party servers.

Before diving into the MCP setup, worth mentioning ZotSeek — a Zotero plugin that adds AI-powered semantic search directly inside Zotero. It runs 100% locally using a bundled embedding model, so you can find papers by meaning, not just keywords, without leaving the app. Great complement to the MCP approach described below.
